website_summaries.verdict: A book that covers a wide variety of spiders and insects.
pros: Nice photos of a decent size that make the bugs and spiders very visible
Covers a large amount of bugs
Easy to use to identify bugs on your hunt
Enough information to have some value for entomologists, but accessible for anyone
cons: The book is a little big to carry around easily as a field guide

customer_reviews.title: Interesting insect guide
customer_reviews.text: This guide is full of different species of insects, arachnids, and arthropods. The pictures are helpful and clear. They organized each group by types (proturans, jumping bristletails, mayflies, earwigs, beetles, fleas, butterflies, spiders, etc.) and it is easy to flip through the book to find what you’re searching for. I enjoy this guide!
customer_reviews.author: Dash10

customer_reviews.title: So grateful for this guide
customer_reviews.text: Bought this book to be able to identify local insects as we are new to the area and very different insects here. A handy reference with nice photos and write ups on many insects. Really like the information it lists about each insect and the quality of the book itself as well. I am not studying insects in a college so if this is what you need it may or may not be as in depth as you're looking for but I would definitely recommend this book. Great book
customer_reviews.author: C Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent holiday gift to stimulate a person's interest in insects
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful colored pictures to stimulate a person's interest in collecting insects. There are two ways of collecting insects: One is to "capture" them with your camera and store them in your photo album. The other way is to kill them and put them physically into a real three-dimensional collection. You can even combine these methods as follows: Look at the description next to the photo in the book to see what the insect eats and what it does. You can then infer whether an insect is beneficial or not. If it's beneficial, capture it with your camera. Otherwise kill it and put it into your three-dimensional collection.
customer_reviews.author: JohnJ

customer_reviews.title: Great reference manual on insects with excellent quality photographs
customer_reviews.text: Great photos and enough description for the reader. If you want more in-depth information on a particular insect, then you can research it further online or elsewhere. But to expect in-depth descriptions in a compact reference manual such as this is unrealistic. You get basic information, and for most people that is enough. The photographs are excellent quality and I really love the book.
customer_reviews.author: L. DONOVAN

customer_reviews.title: My Go-To North American Insect Book
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this guide! It is my first book of choice to help ID insects I come across here in NJ. It has just the right amount of information along with actual photos of the arthropod. However I must mention some people do prefer illustrations for identifying animals instead of actual photos.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied. There is no such thing as a "complete" ...
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied. There is no such thing as a "complete" field guide to anything, but it is good for learning about the insects in our area (South Dakota) and I, my daughter, friends, and nephews were able to identify several insects on our bug hunt.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids to grow into
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old wanted a bug book and I knew he would be frustrated if it didn't contain at least the majority of insects he was trying to look up. I also made sure that whatever book I got included spiders because a lot don't. After reading many reviews I went with this one. He stills needs some help using it but he seems to like it and even took it to school. The teacher used it during their butterfly week to teach the children the parts of a butterfly. So far we've only encountered one bug that we couldn't find an exact match but we got pretty close.
customer_reviews.author: ESK

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight at best
customer_reviews.text: Pros: good pictures. Like that caterpillar images are next to the butterfly/moths. Cons: not very in formative. Last print edition is 10 years ago so any new invasive species are not present. Not very informative other than identification and physically where to specimen is found. In a few instances I could not even find some common species! Pick another book if you want a reference.
customer_reviews.author: RobinLS

customer_reviews.title: Great book to identify spiders
customer_reviews.text: Great book to identify spiders. I purchased the book after a trip to a Florida State Park where there were a lot of banana spiders, near a river. I will bring the book on another adventure sometime.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ferrecchia

customer_reviews.title: Bugs in Color
customer_reviews.text: The main problem with insect & spider books is that there are hundreds of thousands of species and any book can only cover a small sampling. All of the pictures are color photographs which helps a lot with identification. There are also a lot of pictures of related crawlies: spiders and scorpions and centipedes -- oh my. The Peterson field guide might be more useful for an entomology student but I liked this one better.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, and well designed for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: A great little field guide that is easy to use, and valuable to both non-experts and experts. I happen to be an entomologist, and I find it to be of great value. The pictures will make it easy for anyone to find the insect they are looking for, or a similar species.
customer_reviews.author: MarcoliTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUG BOOK
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my grand daughter who is an avid beginner entomologist. We spend hours together reading this book. Great pictures covers a wide variety of common insects for many locations.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: This is such a great field guide! Easy to use, cheep, and full of lots of information.
customer_reviews.text: I used this book 3 times the same exact day I got it. My wife loves to point out where bugs are in the house and I would capture them in a jar and take pictures of them. I then release them and then go back inside to look up on the internet what I had discovered. It would take some time however it was a pain. Now, with this guide I can look them up very quickly and its neat... The first discovery I made with the book was a male "black widow" which was a shock because they didn't look like anything i would have thought. Great book!
customer_reviews.author: Skeletronis

customer_reviews.title: Good general guide book
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book. The pictures are beautiful. It’s not exhaustive though. My niece found a caterpillar and wanted to know what it would turn into. We didn’t find it, but it did have the cow killer.
customer_reviews.author: Hotside

customer_reviews.title: Great photos for initial Identification
customer_reviews.text: I chose this book because it has great photos to compare your bugs/insects/spiders to figure out what they are. We move quite frequently and are faced with new varieties of bugs nearly each time. This helped us find out within a few days of owning it what some of the critters were within our house and whether or not they are harmful to us. I did need to do deeper research on the internet for a couple, but I would still give this a 5-star due to the fact it helps you with the initial first identification of the culprits!
customer_reviews.author: Bizzy Bizzy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't have the Palamedes swallowtail.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good book for ID. Didn't give it the highest rating because didn't have the Palamedes swallowtail in it which is common to Southeast. It did have the green lynx spider and paper wasp. Which it should seeing how common they are also.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Epting

customer_reviews.title: great book to identify insects
customer_reviews.text: a good book to try to identify insects no book could do it all but this one is very good at it. I have the Audubon Society guide to insects and it has some that are not in this one so you might get both books.. I do like this one better.
customer_reviews.author: John WenzelburgerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: "Field Guide to Insects and Spiders" was recommended by a friend in our photography group when I ...
customer_reviews.text: "Field Guide to Insects and Spiders" was recommended by a friend in our photography group when I was having a difficult time identifying a species of spiders. This book is packed full of excellent photos and illustrations, and of course, information. At $20, it's a must-have for anyone who's curious about the world of bugs!
customer_reviews.author: Home Planet Images

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry and great for quick search!
customer_reviews.text: The book comes really handy for a quick search while my son is finding new insects and bugs in the open field
customer_reviews.author: yu m.

customer_reviews.title: Valuable Guide for bug hobbyists.
customer_reviews.text: This guide provides a pretty good summation of many common species, and is a great book for not wanting to spend a lot of money, or simply for one just starting their foray into the amazing world of insects and spider. The size of the book disallows the the amount of species and pictures required for die hard hobbyists or professional, but works well for those curious about the strange bug they found outside, or the creepy crawly crashing a slumber party. Overall, it's a good guide and very fun to thumb through.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J. Snider

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Informative and as described. It has pictures of the insects and spiders instead of drawings. I would recommend this book for anyone who likes the outdoors or just wants to know if a spider they saw is poisonous.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Nice! And a waterproof cover!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an Ecologically Based Pest Management class. It’s in great condition and the cover is waterproof. It’s a thick one!
customer_reviews.author: Ashton Creech

customer_reviews.title: National Wildlife Federation Field Guide to INSECTS AND SPIDERS of North America
customer_reviews.text: I like this book because it has pictures of the different kinds of insects and explains where they live and what they do, predator or plant pest and what they eat and their life cycles. The first book had issues with the binding coming apart from the glue not holding up from high humidity and high temperatures I assume. Amazon replaced it
customer_reviews.author: VICKI

customer_reviews.title: Good book for Identifying insects and spiders
customer_reviews.text: This new book updated multiple insect books I had. Excellent photos. Glad it included both insects and spiders. Most books have one or the other.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite insect field guide
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite insect field guide. Great pictures, enough information without being overwhelming and a simple to use format.
customer_reviews.author: Hanush Sisters

customer_reviews.title: Little info on spiders
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for info on spiders - this only had about 6 pages on spiders. They should change the title - misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good overview of the bugs and insects of North America
customer_reviews.text: This book doesn't have every species but it does cover just about every class of insect there is in North America and gives good information on each such as diet, habitat, life cycle, behavior, range etc. I wanted a book that gave a detailed overview of insects in North America and thats exactly what this is. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: jackovknight

customer_reviews.title: Good field guide
customer_reviews.text: This field guide is a pretty thorough one. It has a lot of all kinds of things, I've taken 2 heavily intensive insect identification classes and it's only failed me a few times on some obscure insects. the cover is water resistant, but it doesn't really do the book much good if it's splashed... maybe if it is set down on the damp ground. Other then that i would recommend this book for a beginner that is just looking for some knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Justin P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Natioal wildlife Federation Field guide to Insects and Spiders
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great for outdoor people that want to be able to identify north american Insects. I was ablr to find a butterfly I had photographed in Colorado. I found out it's name and learned abot butterflies and htier habits. The book went opn to explain the type of plants to grow to draw butterflies to your garden and the best time of day to photograph them If anyone is interested in insects and spiders I highly recomend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Bulger

customer_reviews.title: Very complete and useable for an all-in-one
customer_reviews.text: I'm kind of a field guide junkie, mainly by way of birding. I wanted to start casually identifying insects (meaning not make an obsessive project of it) and I don't think this book has missed yet -- bees, flies, beetles, butterflies, moths, ants, even spiders, I'm pretty sure I've found my answer every time, or very close. Great photos, layout, info. It's perfect if you just want one book. Any butterflies I see in my backyard, for example, are bound to be pretty common, so this book will do it if that's as deep as you want to pursue butterflies (or beetles, or etc. etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Dooley

customer_reviews.title: I love this field guide!
customer_reviews.text: I have the honor of working with close colleagues of the author of this book: Dr. Art Evans. I love this guide, as it is the book that encouraged me to begin insect collecting! Of course the book can't cover all of the insects in North America, but a good amount of my collection has been identified thanks to this field guide. Great info on the insects, and shipped on time and in quality condition!
customer_reviews.author: Kendall King

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful photos
customer_reviews.text: The clear color photos were many and make it easy to identify critters. Nice compact size. Lots of useful info.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Battig

customer_reviews.title: A great guide for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This guide is loaded with insects with great color photos! I was really surprised at how extensive this guide is.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Huddleston

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Recommended to me by an entomologist for my son that has an interest. He likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bought for my daughter. she got lots of extra ...
customer_reviews.text: bought for my daughter. she got lots of extra credit in science class because of this book. she found 3 insects (not commonly seen, although native to our area) in our yard and took them to school and showed the class. Very detailed and informative
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Hunkele

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love knowing what kind of bugs I am looking at...this is a great I.D. book.
customer_reviews.author: linda fielder

customer_reviews.title: useful & fun
customer_reviews.text: Great to keep near the back door so I can run in and ID those suspects! Great range covered, and I usually can nail 'em, but at very least the book allows me to categorize & appreciate those weird critters, learn taxonomy by osmosis, and if I need to go online for an ID, I know how to explain/describe what I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: clonsheefior

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book! Remember that it is a reference guide, this is NOT for identification. Just a helpful and quick reference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing book
customer_reviews.text: Great book! As a bug/nature enthusiast, this book is a no brainer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm looking forward to using this book
customer_reviews.text: I do wild life photography, including insects and spiders. I know what the common ones are but often stumble upon one that I've never seen and struggle to find out what the little critter actually is. I'm looking forward to having more information at my fingertips.
customer_reviews.author: Connie S. Platt

customer_reviews.title: It is an excellent reference. I only wish each subject heading went ...
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this 4 1/2 stars: It is an excellent reference. I only wish each subject heading went into a little more depth. But I guess that would make for a larger book ...
customer_reviews.author: john donne

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive and easy for students to use.
customer_reviews.text: I actually have my students put together insect collections. I used to use the National Audubon Society version, but this book has quite a few more insects, better pictures, and a lot of extra information that is useful in class instruction and identifying insects. It is the best guide I've seen so far which students can easily use.
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Best field guide for the subject matter
customer_reviews.text: This is the best field guide that I have acquired on this subject. Excellent source of information and a plethora of high resolution photos.
customer_reviews.author: Lord of the Underworld

customer_reviews.title: A great reference
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have every species, but it's very comprehensive and has GREAT photos! I learned so much going through this book.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Kossa

customer_reviews.title: The best insect book I've found.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after having checked it out from the library. It's the best insect book I've happened to come across. My 3 year old enjoys it as well-- when she finds a bug, she will come get me to have us look the insect up together. This is a pretty good gift idea, too.
customer_reviews.author: marci m

customer_reviews.title: Book shown not book shipped
customer_reviews.text: Not the book advertised. Instead I was sent a kids fact book about basic insects. It's disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Kiss

customer_reviews.title: Great guide book
customer_reviews.text: Bought if for my daughter's 4-H entomology course. She loves it
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Watts

customer_reviews.title: Good format
customer_reviews.text: What a great book. I find the format very easy to use. I have a Kaufmans and I like that but Kaufman doesn't have the spiders and insects seem harder to find. I also have a Petersons which is more complete but not as much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Warren R.

customer_reviews.title: For the Love of insects and spiders
customer_reviews.text: If you are interested in insects and spiders you will love this field guide. It will have you heading outdoors to study them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite field guide
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite field guide (I also have Peterson's and Audobon's). The pictures are good and the range/size/habitat information is listed on the same page. I very much apprecciate not having to flip to alternate pages to get the information that I am looking for. If you are looking for a book that is not in the field I would recommend Insects: Their Natural History and Diversity by Stephen Marshall, but to travel this is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Peter F. Gawne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: An excellent resource for identifying insects and learning about them.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Our whole family love this book so many colorful photo's.
customer_reviews.author: sherry a haug

customer_reviews.title: Excellent information and easy to locate insects
customer_reviews.text: I use this book in my forest kindergarten class each year !
customer_reviews.author: Charity Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Lots of info, but . . .
customer_reviews.text: . . . more often than not, I can't find the exact bug if it's anything other than something common. I also think the photos could be a bit better (a lot better), and it would be nice to have a color guide integrated into the index to help someone hone in on a bug they might not know. To be fair, insects are very diverse, but still, if I can find an insect with a couple of minutes doing a google search, I'm not happy that it's not in the book. Still, like I said, useful, and most of the time it gets you the information you want.
customer_reviews.author: E. D'Alise

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves insects and researching all he can about them. This guide Is easy to use and the quality is wonderful. It's amazing to see him run inside to grab his guide book to learn about the insect he found.
customer_reviews.author: LadySkeptic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great resource for just what you are looking for. It's easy to use and simple to understand. The color pictures make it so much easier than a black and white photo and the index helps with simple indentification.
customer_reviews.author: Mouse3324

customer_reviews.title: Great response from my son.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Biology AP son. He was so excited. He loves to learn about all sorts of different things. Awesome book.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Great photos, well organized
customer_reviews.text: This book is just what I had hoped it would be. The photos are well done and are placed next to the description of the creatures that they illustrate, unlike some other guides which require constant flipping between the plates and the text. The organization by type of insect (or spider) is helpful. I have not found every insect that I have looked for, but that is probably inevitable in a book of this size. After considering several other guides, I'm glad that I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Filkins

customer_reviews.text: A good reference, although I am unsure if all of the common species we see out here in the Mountain West are represented.
customer_reviews.author: Neil G.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful book love the photos
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful book. love the photos and the information. Some insects that are pretty normal however are not listed. I do realize that it is impossible to list all the insects. excellent book for the price. well made and sturdy. we will be using it in scouts for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Very comprehensive. Has more entries than any other guide ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comprehensive. Has more entries than any other guide I have.

customer_reviews.title: Love this book
customer_reviews.text: Nice little book to carry in the fields when exploring and learning with kids.

customer_reviews.text: This book really bugged me, but that’s why I bought it... 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: This book is phenomenal. An entomologists bible. Often ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is phenomenal. An entomologists bible. Often lacking certain rare families, but has all of the orders of insects and non-insect hexapods. Very colorful and resourceful. I plan on buying other field guide books from this same company.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Czarnetzke

customer_reviews.title: I would love this if it had more of the Mosquito Species ...
customer_reviews.text: I would love this if it had more of the Mosquito Species in it. It is very difficult to find color photos of each species of mosquito.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book for anyone interested in bugs - even toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Great book even for toddlers. It's full of information and detailed pictures.

customer_reviews.title: insects
customer_reviews.text: I needed a more up to date book on insects that is why I purchased this book. This is an excellent insect book. It has the photos and the descriptions together on the same page. Unlike other books where you have to go between the front/back of the book which is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: MAR

customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars if it were hardback or something more rugged. Amazing content, though.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really like this book. It is not a complete listing of all but good overview.

customer_reviews.title: Natl. Wildlife Federation Field Guide to Insects and Spiders of N. America
customer_reviews.text: This is a complete, informative, and handy field guide to insects and spiders of N. America. Beautiful photography and plenty of it. My only con is the small text. into bugs

customer_reviews.title: nice book
customer_reviews.text: chose this book because we were constantly checking it out at the library and knew it was a good book so my daughter decided to just buy it because she is doing a bug project for 4h very thick and very informative

customer_reviews.title: Not organized for easy identification for amateurs who aren't sure what they're looking ...
customer_reviews.text: Not ideal for carrying around, as the pages are thick making the book heavier than it needs to be. Not organized for easy identification for amateurs who aren't sure what they're looking at. Missing a lot of widely-used common names, which just makes things more confusing. Nice color pictures for the species that it does include.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Everything you wanted to know about the creepy crawlies!
customer_reviews.text: Everything you wanted to know about the creepy crawlies! Great pix/ID.

customer_reviews.title: Book in terrific condition
customer_reviews.text: The insect guide was in great condition and included all the educational material that is often missing. Even bought a camera with macro capability from Amazon this week so I can photo insects here in FL. M F in Sarasota Fl.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Freel

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Love this book, has nice full color pictures and is layer out nicely. Was so much fun identifying he various spiders, and water bugs we found in our yard.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: A very clean copy has been delivered to my address and the book contents are great. It helps to identify some of the species when I take my son to the Nature Park. It even explains the techniques required for collecting the insects and identification. Great book.
customer_reviews.author: Michel Helou

customer_reviews.title: Great Book!
customer_reviews.text: The colored pictures and thick pages make it very easy to skim and find just the bug you are looking for! It doesn't have drawn out descriptions of the insects, so it's fun and easy to read about each one. I'm so glad I picked this field guide.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reference guide.
customer_reviews.text: Best book there is for home gardener identification of insects. Great pictures and info.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book!

customer_reviews.text: My granddaughters had a ball with this book, suggested as a gift by their father!

customer_reviews.text: Art Evans' NWF Insect and Spider Field Guide is the best book of its type I have ever seen. It is the one book I take to the field with confidence. I know I will be able to promptly and correctly identify the insects I encounter in various natural environments. The book came lickety split and is like new. Thanks!!!

customer_reviews.text: This book is really helpful and has wonderful real-life pictures. It's perfect for my entomology class.

customer_reviews.text: This book was recommended for my Entomology class to help with keying. Very good to get to orders and most families as well as detailed descriptions and excellent pictures.

customer_reviews.text: This book kept several in my family mesmerized at Christmas and still does, a month later. Great book. Very informative and easy to understand and read.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Staley

customer_reviews.title: Great Book!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book!! It's a must have for anyone into bugs and spiders. I highly recommend getting this!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Arbenz

customer_reviews.title: works or not
customer_reviews.text: great for adults or kids alike easy to work great pictures nice amount of info too help live and death time eggs cycles will help with gray areas
customer_reviews.author: works or not

customer_reviews.title: Good basic bug guide
customer_reviews.text: good basic bug guide. It has real pictures in it which is a huge plus for me. gives you a good start in to bug identification.
customer_reviews.author: Rutter

customer_reviews.title: pest control operator
customer_reviews.text: A must if you are a pest management professional. Great description, easy to read, will make you feel like a professional having this in your truck.
customer_reviews.author: Christian M.

customer_reviews.title: Great color pictures
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with the wonderful color photographs of the insects, just like you see them in your own back yard
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Foster

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Book was supposed to be decent quality, it is not. Several pages are on the verge of falling out.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Can't find the bug!
customer_reviews.text: If you already know the scientific name for an insect and want to look it up, this is the book for you!! If you saw a bug and want to find out what it is, fuggetaboutit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

product_meta.title: National Wildlife Federation Field Guide to Insects and Spiders & Related Species of North America
